question: My lab was diagnosed with diabetes in April of 2012, she was five at the time.  Fast forward to January 2013 and she now is slowly recovering from a bad bout of acute pancreatitis.  She was in the vet hospital for four days and it was kind of touch and go.  The vet and I have always had a problem getting her sugar count down since she was diagnosed.  When she became ill last week she was getting 40cc on insulin twice daily.  Her sugar was still in the 400s.  While she was in the hospital the vet worked on her diabetes also and figured it was going to take 50cc twice daily.  Four days ago when she came home the vet had given her 50cc and brought her suger down to 50 they had to give her dextrose to get it back up.  They told us to give her 45cc twice daily after we got her home.  She has been drinking just fine but not eating much since she got back home so we've only been giving her 22 units a day.  Two days in a row she vomited once 6 hours after her shot.  Just the one episode each day. I took her back to the vet expecting the worse and she said all her blood counts for the pancreatitis were good but her bile might be alittle backed up from the inflammation of the pancreas.  The big shocker was her blood glucose was at 107..this was only with 22units of insulin.  Even when I took her in for her pancreatits her sugar was at 700 and that was after vomiting most of the day.  I'm wondering if the 22 units is taking her sugar to low thats why shes been getting sick at the same time 2 days in a row.  She really hasnt been eating much since she came home....still feeling crappy and on pain meds and anti nausea meds.  Could she be in a temporary diabetes remission?
title: pancreatitis causing diabetes remission?
